  817. A7med says:
    August 15th, 2015 at 2:09 pm

    my solution for onUpgrade not fully tested but seems to be working

    after changing the database version on constructor

    super(context, DB_NAME, null, 1); //1 is version number make increment by one if u want to upgrad
    if u make it 2 or greater the onUpgrade will be called by itself no extra code needed same apply if u make the version lower the onDowngrade will be called you can override onDowngrade the same way if u want to always keep the apk database version

    @Override
    public void onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase db, int oldVersion, int newVersion) {

    try{

    //Open your local db as the input stream
    InputStream myInput = myContext.getAssets().open(DB_NAME);

    // Path to the just created empty db
    String outFileName = DB_PATH + DB_NAME;

    //Open the empty db as the output stream
    OutputStream myOutput = new FileOutputStream(outFileName);

    //transfer bytes from the inputfile to the outputfile
    byte[] buffer = new byte[1024];
    int length;
    while ((length = myInput.read(buffer)) > 0) {
    myOutput.write(buffer, 0, length);
    }

    db.setVersion(newVersion);
    //Close the streams
    myOutput.flush();
    myOutput.close();
    myInput.close();
    Log.v(” done”, “Upgraded ” + newVersion) ;
    } catch (IOException e) {

    }
    }

    Reply

  822. Waqar says:
    October 17th, 2015 at 9:28 pm

    Hi Guys. Need help on the code. I have tried various fixes mentioned in the post but nothings seems to work. I am new to programming and Android, so would really appreciate your help.

    Database_Helper Class:
    package com.database1;
    import java.io.File;
    import java.io.FileOutputStream;
    import java.io.IOException;
    import java.io.InputStream;
    import java.io.OutputStream;
    import android.content.Context;
    import android.database.Cursor;
    import android.database.SQLException;
    import android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase;
    import android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.CursorFactory;
    import android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper;
    import android.widget.Toast;

    public class Database_Helper extends SQLiteOpenHelper{

    private static String DB_Name = “mcq.sqlite”;
    private static String Table_Name = “data”;
    private Context mcontext;
    private String path = “/data/data/com.database1/databases/”;
    private SQLiteDatabase mydatabase;

    public Database_Helper(Context context){
    super(context, DB_Name, null, 1);
    this.mcontext = context;

    /* try {
    create_database();
    open_database();
    } catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
    }
    */
    }

    public void create_database () throws IOException {

    if (check_database()) {
    // check if database exists or not
    copydatabase();
    this.close();
    }
    else {
    // if does not exist, copy database
    //System.out.println(“Error creating database”);
    copydatabase();
    this.close();
    }

    }

    public boolean check_database () {
    File f = new File (path + DB_Name);
    if (f.exists()) {
    return true;
    }
    else {
    return false;
    }
    }

    public void copydatabase(){
    try {
    InputStream myInput = mcontext.getAssets().open(DB_Name);
    String outFilename = path + DB_Name;
    OutputStream myOutput = new FileOutputStream (outFilename);
    byte[] buffer = new byte[1024];
    int length;
    while ((length = myInput.read(buffer))>0);
    {
    myOutput.write(buffer,0,length);
    }
    myOutput.flush();
    myOutput.close();
    myInput.close();

    } catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
    }
    }

    public void open_database() throws SQLException {
    mydatabase = SQLiteDatabase.openDatabase(path + DB_Name, null, SQLiteDatabase.CREATE_IF_NECESSARY);
    }

    public void close_database () {
    if (mydatabase != null) {
    mydatabase.close();
    }
    super.close();
    }

    public String databaseToString(){

    String dbString = “”;
    //SQLiteDatabase db = getReadableDatabase();
    String query = “SELECT * FROM ” + Table_Name;

    // cursor
    Cursor c = mydatabase.rawQuery(query,null);

    while(!c.isAfterLast()){
    if(c.getString(c.getColumnIndex(“Question”))!=null){
    dbString += c.getString(c.getColumnIndex(“Question”));
    dbString += “\n”;
    }
    }
    c.close();
    mydatabase.close();
    return dbString;
    }
    @Override
    public void onCreate(SQLiteDatabase db) {
    // TODO Auto-generated method stub
    }
    @Override
    public void onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase db, int oldVersion, int newVersion) {
    // TODO Auto-generated method stub

    }
    }

    Main Activity:
    package com.database1;

    import java.io.IOException;

    import com.database1.Database_Helper;
    import com.database1.R;

    import android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity;
    import android.database.SQLException;
    import android.os.Bundle;
    import android.widget.TextView;
    import android.widget.Toast;

    public class MainActivity extends AppCompatActivity {

    TextView dbOutputView;
    Database_Helper dbHandler;

    @Override
    protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);

    //dbOutputView = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.outputView);
    dbHandler = new Database_Helper(this);
    //Toast.makeText(Database_Helper.this,”id: ” + c.getString(0) + “\n”, Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
    printDatabase();

    /* try
    {
    dbHandler.create_database();
    dbOutputView = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.outputView);
    dbOutputView.setText(“Success”);
    }
    catch (IOException ioe)
    {
    dbOutputView = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.outputView);
    dbOutputView.setText(“Error”);
    throw new Error (“Unable to create database”);
    }

    try
    {
    dbHandler.open_database();
    dbOutputView = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.outputView);
    dbOutputView.setText(“Success”);

    }
    catch(SQLException sqle)
    {
    throw sqle;
    }
    */

    }

    public void printDatabase(){
    String dbString1 = dbHandler.databaseToString();
    dbOutputView.setText(dbString1);
    }
    }

  823. Waqar says:
    October 18th, 2015 at 6:15 pm

    Hi Guys. I need help on the following code. I am new to Android and programming and have tried various fixes in this blog but nothing seems to work. I would appreciate if you could debug the code.

    Thanks.

    Database Helper Class

    package com.database1;
    import java.io.File;
    import java.io.FileOutputStream;
    import java.io.IOException;
    import java.io.InputStream;
    import java.io.OutputStream;
    import android.content.Context;
    import android.database.Cursor;
    import android.database.SQLException;
    import android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase;
    import android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.CursorFactory;
    import android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper;
    import android.widget.Toast;

    public class Database_Helper extends SQLiteOpenHelper{

    private static String DB_Name = “mcq.sqlite”;
    private static String Table_Name = “data”;
    private Context mcontext;
    private String path = “/data/data/com.database1/databases/”;
    private SQLiteDatabase mydatabase;

    public Database_Helper(Context context){
    super(context, DB_Name, null, 1);
    this.mcontext = context;

    /* try {
    create_database();
    open_database();
    } catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
    }
    */
    }

    public void create_database () throws IOException {

    if (check_database()) {
    // check if database exists or not
    copydatabase();
    this.close();
    }
    else {
    // if does not exist, copy database
    //System.out.println(“Error creating database”);
    copydatabase();
    this.close();
    }
    }

    public boolean check_database () {
    File f = new File (path + DB_Name);
    if (f.exists()) {
    return true;
    }
    else {
    return false;
    }
    }

    public void copydatabase(){

    try {
    InputStream myInput = mcontext.getAssets().open(DB_Name);
    String outFilename = path + DB_Name;
    OutputStream myOutput = new FileOutputStream (outFilename);
    byte[] buffer = new byte[1024];
    int length;
    while ((length = myInput.read(buffer))>0);
    {
    myOutput.write(buffer,0,length);
    }
    myOutput.flush();
    myOutput.close();
    myInput.close();

    } catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
    }
    }

    public void open_database() throws SQLException {
    mydatabase = SQLiteDatabase.openDatabase(path + DB_Name, null, SQLiteDatabase.CREATE_IF_NECESSARY);
    }

    public void close_database () {
    if (mydatabase != null) {
    mydatabase.close();
    }
    super.close();
    }

    public String databaseToString(){

    String dbString = “”;
    //SQLiteDatabase db = getReadableDatabase();
    String query = “SELECT * FROM ” + Table_Name;

    // cursor
    Cursor c = mydatabase.rawQuery(query,null);

    while(!c.isAfterLast()){
    if(c.getString(c.getColumnIndex(“Question”))!=null){
    dbString += c.getString(c.getColumnIndex(“Question”));
    dbString += “\n”;
    }
    }
    c.close();
    mydatabase.close();
    return dbString;
    }

    @Override
    public void onCreate(SQLiteDatabase db) {
    // TODO Auto-generated method stub
    }

    @Override
    public void onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase db, int oldVersion, int newVersion) {
    // TODO Auto-generated method stub
    }
    }

    Main Activity

    package com.database1;
    import java.io.IOException;
    import com.database1.Database_Helper;
    import com.database1.R;
    import android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity;
    import android.database.SQLException;
    import android.os.Bundle;
    import android.widget.TextView;
    import android.widget.Toast;

    public class MainActivity extends AppCompatActivity {

    TextView dbOutputView;
    Database_Helper dbHandler;

    @Override
    protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);

    //dbOutputView = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.outputView);
    dbHandler = new Database_Helper(this);
    //Toast.makeText(Database_Helper.this,”id: ” + c.getString(0) + “\n”, Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
    printDatabase();

    /* try
    {
    dbHandler.create_database();
    dbOutputView = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.outputView);
    dbOutputView.setText(“Success”);
    }
    catch (IOException ioe)
    {
    dbOutputView = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.outputView);
    dbOutputView.setText(“Error”);
    throw new Error (“Unable to create database”);
    }

    try
    {
    dbHandler.open_database();
    dbOutputView = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.outputView);
    dbOutputView.setText(“Success”);

    }
    catch(SQLException sqle)
    {
    throw sqle;
    }
    */
    }
    public void printDatabase(){
    String dbString1 = dbHandler.databaseToString();
    dbOutputView.setText(dbString1);
    }
    }

  828. fabrizio says:

    “no such table” problem worked out!

    I solved just changing
    DB_NAME =”mydb”
    with
    DB_NAME=”mydb.db”

  831. khuhsi says:

    no such table ‘TABLE NAME’ found ?
    ———————————————-
    I also get the same error.
    Reason : when we uninstall app ,it does not delete the database!
    How to solve ?
    clear app cache,clear app data,uninstall app,find and delete database which you created finally reinstall the app.

    hurreeyy!
    It will definitely works.
